text:
This is a 'I think we did something wrong' problem.  It should be easy.

We download TomCat, version 2.2.3, and are implementing it on our 3270 based 
mainframe system running z/OS 1.7.  We have JZOS downloaded from an IBM 
website.  Our JCL provided by JZOS is failing because it can't find 
bootstrap.jar.  I go to TOMCAT_HOME (which is /local/apps/tomcat/httpd-2.3.3 
on our systems) and do the command 'find . -name bootstrap.jar' and find that 
we don't have this file.  How can this be, did we download the wrong thing?  
Should we download something else?
creator: mullink@us.ibm.com

text: Bugzilla is not s support forum. Please use the users mailing list.
creator: markt@apache.org
